answers.answer: Hi I was induced with my first due to pre eclampsia (not sure on spelling either haha) took ages but I was very stressed, had forceps delivery and he is now 7 years old :-)I had an epidural so can't say what it felt like but I'm sure it will all be fine good luck and let us know how you get on xx

I was induced for the same reason and all went really well. First of they started with softening my cervix on the first day, then on 2nd day more medicines up my cervix to get it more ready and the next day midwife broke my waters and took me to delivery room at 9am. They put me on the drip and at 4pm I was in proper labour. My baby arrived just before 8pm after an hour of pushing.If I could give you any tips it would be:- be patient coz all of the stages with softening the cervix take time- use that time to rest and relax coz everything is under control, you are in the hospital already being looked after the staff- don't stress yourself, the happier you will be the easier it will be- if you can't cope with pain ask for pain relief

Yup I was induced with first at 39+5 and ended in csection. And y is it just suspected y are they not sure? Do you have protein in your urine,high bp, swelling, bad headaches? If they v are not sure that's dumb to induce you. There is a very simple blood test( which I had done today) to check for sure. Not all inductions end in cesarean but does increase the chance.
Thank you guys!  That makes me feel a whole lot better about it :)
What happens during a c-section?  Does it hurt or take any of the joy out of the experience?

I was induced with my first at 41 + 3. They gave me the stuff to soften my cervix. The next day they broke my water and started pitocin. That night (well over 24 hours later) I had a c section. I barely made it to two cm. That is just my experience of course...lots of people have successful inductions. :)
Im getting induced on the same day! Good luck to us!

question: So, I'll be 39 weeks on Monday the 27th and they are going to induce me due to suspected preeclampsia <-- (probably misspelled ). Anyway, I'm scared, I've heard it usually ends in c-section and complications. How do they induce you?  What does it feel like?  How long does it take?  Anyone who's been induced, can you shed some light for me so I kinda know what to expect :) thanks
title: Getting induced Monday
